page.title: 19STRETTON PLANTS AND TREES
page.content: The Civic Society is interested in plants and making the country beautiful. They plant bulbs and trees around the place. In the trim neat gardens around the area people grow plants such as daffodils and roses around their borders. There are now less wild flowers in the fields because of drainage and use of herbicides. Tree preservation orders are being lifted because no one dared to cut down any trees and so woods were getting neglected. Instead, advice is now being given to help thin woodland. The{sundew}is one rare plant which can be seen on the Long Mynd. It has spikes round its leaves and snaps up insects. Whinberries grow abundantly on the bracken covered hillsides.
